description: The White House is elevating two longtime press aides following the departure of press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre’s top deputy, as part of an effort to bolster the press shop’s operations ahead of President Joe Biden’s reelection bid.
title: White House Promotes Press Aides as Biden Sharpens 2024 Focus

description: Donald Trump’s intimate moments with an adult film star spilled out into open court on Tuesday as Stormy Daniels described her alleged affair with the former president in a highly-anticipated moment of his hush-money trial.
title: Trump’s Private Life Exposed in Intimate Stormy Daniels Testimony

description: Donald Trump’s criminal trial for allegedly mishandling classified documents has been postponed indefinitely in a blow to the Justice Department’s efforts to obtain a jury verdict before November’s presidential election.
title: Trump Judge Indefinitely Postpones Documents Case Trial

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Josh Wingrove previews the president’s trip to Wisconsin to highlight development at a spot that also happens to be the site of a failure by his predecessor. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Heads to Site of Trump’s Foxconn Failure in 2024 Battleground

description: Romania will consider sending one of its Patriot air defense systems to neighboring Ukraine to help the war-torn country fend off Russian aerial attacks, President Klaus Iohannis said on Tuesday.
title: Romania to Consider Sending One of Its Patriot Defense Systems to Ukraine

description: Prominent business leaders, including Darcy Penick of Bergdorf Goodman Inc., former Yahoo CEO Marissa Mayer, venture capitalist Vinod Khosla and Atlanta Falcons owner Arthur Blank, are among those hosting political fundraisers for President Joe Biden as the campaign taps Democratic-donor rich Silicon Valley and Chicago for cash.
title: NFL Falcons Owner, Bergdorf Goodman’s Penick to Raise Biden Cash

description: China’s President Xi Jinping arrived in Serbia on the second leg of his European tour as he sought to tighten Beijing’s embrace of the Balkan nation in contrast with a more difficult relationship with most of Europe.
title: China’s Xi Arrives in Serbia to Bolster Ties With Europe’s East

description: Venezuela is allowing a small startup to import fuels even as the country struggles to feed its owns refineries and the recent reimposition of US sanctions presses on its industry.
title: Venezuela’s Oil Monopoly Eases with Deal to Allow Private Firm to Import Diesel

description: India’s high commissioner to Canada says diplomatic talks are underway to find solutions to “issues of concern” to both countries, in his first public remarks since three Indian nationals were charged with the murder of a Sikh activist.
title: Indian Envoy Says Talks Underway to Resolve Diplomatic Dispute With Canada

description: Venezuela is targeting a group of investigative journalists as part of a wide-ranging corruption probe into billions of dollars of missing oil revenue.
title: Investigative Reporters Targeted in Venezuelan Government Probe

description: The US soldier detained on criminal charges in eastern Russia — adding to the tally of Americans held in the country during a low point in relations with Washington — flew there “for personal reasons” and without official authorization, the Army said Tuesday.
title: Pentagon Says US Soldier Held in Russia Went for ‘Personal Reasons’

description: President Joe Biden plans to huddle with chief executives from large companies to discuss the state of the economy and efforts to implement his infrastructure and clean energy policies, according to the White House.
title: Biden to Meet Citi, Marriott, United CEOs to Discuss Economy

description: The Biden administration said Israel and Hamas should be able to resolve their differences over a proposed cease-fire, contradicting top Israeli officials who said the two remain far apart.
title: US Says Israel and Hamas Can Resolve Differences Over Cease-Fire

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said a planned reform to the nation’s pensions system will be approved in cabinet this month, pushing back against reports of fresh tensions in the ruling coalition over economic policy.
title: Scholz Plays Down Reports of Tensions Over Pension-Reform Plans

description: Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker, the billionaire who championed Chicago’s bid for the Democratic National Convention, dismissed concerns about a repeat of historic riots as the city beefs up security measures for the August presidential nominating event.
title: Pritzker Downplays Protest Risks for DNC Convention in Chicago

description: China is likely using data from hacks of UK government institutions to build profiles of British military personnel and people in other sensitive roles as Beijing expands espionage against the US and its allies, government officials and cyber experts said.
title: China Seen Using Hacks to Build Profiles of UK Defense Personnel

description: TikTok sued the US government in the first challenge to a new law that would force Chinese parent company ByteDance Ltd. to divest itself of the popular video app or face a ban.
title: TikTok Sues US Government to Block Divest-or-Ban Law

description: On the second day of Xi Jinping’s visit to France, Emmanuel Macron ditched the gold-plated formalities of Paris’s Elysee Palace to take the Chinese president to the mountains where he spent his childhood holidays.
title: Macron Offers Xi Cheese and Armagnac on Chilly Mountain Visit

description: Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said European Union-China relations should be “fair” and require a “level playing field.”
title: Bundesbank Chief Says EU-China Ties Need Level Playing Field

description: John Swinney was elected Scotland’s First Minister, as his governing Scottish National Party seeks to arrest a long-term slide in the polls ahead of a UK-wide vote expected in the second half of the year.
title: Swinney Elected Scotland First Minister as SNP Tries to Rebuild

description: Israel’s move to take control of the Rafah crossing into Egypt has sparked furious debate about its end goal: Is this the start of a long-threatened invasion of the southern Gaza city, or an attempt to pressure Hamas to ease conditions for a cease-fire and the release of hostages?
title: Israel Edges Into Rafah With Tensions High Over Deadlocked Talks

description: Jerome Powell is struggling to shed his label as the lowest-rated US Federal Reserve chairman in nearly a quarter century, as inflation persists and high prices irritate US consumers, according to a new Gallup poll.
title: Powell’s Public Confidence Nears Historic Lows, Gallup Finds

description: More Canadians have a negative view of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s planned capital-gains tax hike than a positive one, while most lack confidence that housing will become affordable in five years, according to a new poll.
title: Canadians Split on Trudeau’s Capital Gains Tax Boost, Poll Finds

description: China may soon release audio of a purported phone call with a Philippine military official that Beijing claims is evidence of an agreement over disputed territory in the South China Sea, according to Chinese officials.
title: China Threatens to Release Audio of Secret Deal With Philippines

description: More crude diverted to export shipments as processing rates fall
title: Russian Crude Flows Top 2023 Levels With Refineries Constrained

description: Donald Trump at Manhattan criminal court in New York on May 7. Photographer: Win McNamee/Getty Images
title: Updates From Trump Hush-Money Criminal Trial

description: Ukrainian authorities said they foiled a plot to assassinate President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and other high-ranking officials, making the announcement on the day of Vladimir Putin’s inauguration in Moscow.
title: Ukraine Says It Arrested Two in Zelenskiy Assassination Plot

description: The University of Chicago ended a pro-Palestinian encampment on its campus, saying safety concerns drove its decision after negotiations with protesters failed.
title: University of Chicago Clears Out Encampment Without Arrests

description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is expected to stress her government’s commitment to ending the presence of foreign fighters in Libya as she promotes her so-called “Mattei plan” for the region during a state visit to the divided African country.
title: Italy’s Meloni to Make Push for Foreign Fighters to Leave Libya

description: South Africa asked the government of Equatorial Guinea to release two of its citizens who’ve been detained in the country for more than a year.
title: South Africa Asks Equatorial Guinea to Release Jailed Engineers

description: Northwestern University and Brown University headed off the police crackdowns that hit campuses from New York to California last week by making concessions to pro-Palestinian protesters. Now they’re being slammed by critics who say they capitulated to an angry mob.
title: Colleges Ripped for Agreeing to Hear Israel Divestment Demands

description: Lithuania’s president called for improved relations with China after the establishment of a trade office with Taiwan three years ago triggered a rift between the world’s No. 2 economy and the European Union member state.
title: Lithuanian President Calls for Better Relations With China

description: A.P. Moller - Maersk A/S said a successful rival bidder fell short of tender requirements as it seeks to overturn the award of a concession to run and expand sub-Saharan Africa’s biggest container port to Filipino billionaire Enrique Razon’s harbor firm.
title: Maersk Questions Rival’s Solvency in Battle Over South Africa’s Durban Container Port

description: Police conducted a search Tuesday of the European Parliament offices in Brussels used by Alternative for Germany lawmaker Maximilian Krah and an assistant who’s accused of spying for China.
title: German AfD Lawmaker’s Offices Searched in China Spying Probe

description: Positive rhetoric on luxury tariffs can’t hide the gloom as French and Chinese leaders talk past each other.
title: After Macron and Xi's Honeymoon, the Cognac Hangover

description: Rachel Reeves suggested Labour can now win anywhere in the UK after the Conservative Party’s mismanagement of the economy eroded trust in the government.
title: Rachel Reeves Says There Are No ‘No-Go Areas’ for Labour in UK Election

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Voters Divided as Family Feud Takes Center Stage in India’s Baramati

description: The far-right Alternative for Germany was in the ascendant last year, when it peeled away support from Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s troubled ruling coalition to become the second-most popular party in opinion polls. That momentum has now stalled. In January, reports that senior AfD figures discussed deporting German citizens with immigrant roots caused indignation and a wave of protests across the country. Now the movement is battling allegations that two of its election candidates have links to Rus
title: Why German Far-Right AfD Party Has Run Into Trouble

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk called on the European Union to mobilize at least 100 billion euros ($108 billion) on defense and build a joint air-defense system as the bloc contends with Russian aggression.
title: Poland’s Tusk Calls on EU to Build Joint Air-Defense System

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Putin Is Unassailable at Home and Defiant Abroad

description: The European Union has proposed restrictions on 11 vessels that contribute to Russia’s ability to sustain its war against Ukraine.
title: EU Aims to Target 11 Russian Ships Involved in Sanctions-Busting

description: Tehreek-i-Taliban Pakistan — a local offshoot of neighboring Afghanistan’s Taliban - planned and executed a suicide bomb attack that killed five Chinese engineers in March, according to Pakistan’s military spokesman.
title: Pakistan Says Taliban Offshoot Behind Attacks on China Interests

description: China accused an Australian military aircraft of conducting dangerous maneuvers, escalating a dispute over a recent incident involving the nations’ two militaries.
title: China Blasts Australian Military After Helicopter Incident

description: Vladimir Putin, who’s ruled Russia for the whole of the 21st century so far, was sworn in for a fifth term as president, amid renewed nuclear saber-rattling with the West over his war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Sworn In for New Term Amid Growing Conflict With West

description: President Joe Biden plans to denounce antisemitism at college campus protests against Israel during an annual Holocaust commemoration, directly taking on demonstrations that threaten to fracture his political coalition.
title: Biden to Decry Campus Antisemitism in Holocaust Memorial Speech

description: UniCredit SpA is likely among lenders that have received a letter by the European Central Bank urging them to reduce their exposure to Russia, after Raiffeisen Bank International AG last month revealed it was told by the regulator to further cut its Russian business.
title: UniCredit’s Orcel Says All Russia-Exposed Banks Got ECB Letter

description: Washington is concerned about growing efforts by Iran and groups like Hamas to solicit money in Southeast Asia, a senior US Treasury official said on Tuesday during a visit intended to rally support for sanctions enforcement in the region.
title: US Seeks to Curb Iran’s Fundraising Capacity in Southeast Asia

description: Shares of a Chinese beverage maker soared after a surge in online sales following unconfirmed reports that the company’s packaging included criticisms of Japan’s discharge of treated wastewater from a nuclear plant.
title: China Milktea Brand Shares Soar as Anti-Japan Reports Lift Sales

description: UK armed forces personnel had personal data accessed in a recent cyberattack that was likely carried out by China, British officials familiar with the matter said.
title: China Seen as Likely Culprit in UK Defense Ministry Cyberattack

description: President Xi Jinping vowed to “never forget” NATO’s deadly bombing of the Chinese embassy in Belgrade, hours before arriving in Serbia on a swing through Europe aimed at dividing Brussels’ support for the US.
title: Xi Vows to Remember ‘Flagrant’ US Bombing of Chinese Embassy

description: Israeli troops took control of the Rafah border-crossing area in Gaza on Tuesday morning, with Hamas saying all aid flows from Egypt had stopped.
title: Israel’s Troops Take Control of Rafah Border Crossing in Gaza

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is capitalizing on his administration’s efforts to bring an end to Israel’s war on Hamas as he seeks to draw votes in the only province that isn’t controlled by the ruling African National Congress.
title: Ramaphosa Touts Israel Court Win in South African Votes Drive

description: Thailand’s new Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira urged the central bank to support government policies, signaling pressure may continue on the Bank of Thailand to cut interest rates.
title: New Thai Finance Chief Signals Rate-Cut Calls Will Persist

description: Check after check after check was displayed on screens for a New York jury on Monday carrying Donald Trump’s distinctive signature scrawled with a black sharpie.
title: Trump Jury Shown Check After Check He Signed to Repay Cohen

description: A menos de un mes de las elecciones presidenciales, la favorita Claudia Sheinbaum continúa con una ventaja dominante, una señal de alerta para Xóchitl Gálvez. En las últimas semanas, Jorge Álvarez Máynez ganó terreno y llegó al 12% de la intención de voto.
title: Ventaja de Sheinbaum se amplía a 30 puntos; se agota el tiempo para Gálvez

description: Less than a month from Mexico's elections, frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum continues to hold a commanding lead, an alarming sign for Xochitl Galvez. In recent weeks, Jorge Alvarez Maynez gained ground and got to 12% voter intention.
title: Sheinbaum Widens Lead to 30 Points as Time Runs Out for Gálvez

description: President starts a new term under little pressure to end the war as nationalist appeals rally support and harsh crackdowns stifle protests.
title: Russians Are Coming to Terms With Putin’s War in Ukraine

description: Voting kicked off in Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s home state of Gujarat in the third phase of India’s election, with campaigning becoming increasingly acrimonious between the two main parties.
title: Modi, Adani Vote as India Election Campaign Turns Hostile
